intro.title: Welcome to Trust Jar
intro.lead: The app helps foster honest dialogue and track trust level.

repair.title: Repair Trust
repair.lead: Go through the steps together: stay calm, understand feelings and needs, choose a repair action, and agree on a clear plan.

pause.title: Pause & breathe
pause.summary: Calm first: a few slow breaths. The goal is to restore trust, not to punish.
prompts: We’re talking to rebuild trust and understand each other.

facts.title: Facts without labels
facts.summary: Separate facts from interpretations. Capture what happened.
promptsChild: How was it from your side?
What were you trying to get or avoid?

feelings.title: Feelings & needs
feelings.summary: Name feelings and the needs underneath, for both sides.
promptsParent: I feel … because … matters to me.
promptsChild: I felt …; it was important for me to …
What would help you next time?

impact.title: Impact
impact.summary: Understand the consequences for relationship, rules, safety and plans.
prompts: How did this affect our trust/agreements?
What became harder for you/for the family?

amends.title: Make amends
amends.summary: Choose a concrete action that reduces harm and strengthens trust.
exercises: Options: specific apology; fix/replace what’s possible; help/contribution; honest weekly report on rules.
Pick a realistic step the child can do (with your support).

plan.title: Agreement & boundaries
plan.summary: Define a clear plan: what, when, how to verify. Clarify boundaries and consequences if it repeats.
prompts: What exactly will you do? By when? How will we know it’s done?
Which rules do we fix? What happens if they’re broken again?

appreciation.title: Appreciation
appreciation.summary: Acknowledge effort and openness – it supports motivation.
prompts: I notice your effort — that helps our trust.

followup.title: Follow-up
followup.summary: Set a brief check-in in 1–3 days to review progress, support, and adjust.
prompts: If something is hard, we’ll think how to help.
